articles.description: The swimming prowess of the Syrian Nardini sisters helped save their ​sinking ​refugee boat. Here Yusra talks about The Swimmers, the ​new film that tells their amazing story
articles.content: Halfway across the Aegean Sea, the motor on the boat carrying sisters Sara and Yusra Mardini away from war-torn Syria suddenly stalled. They had boarded the leaky rubber dinghy, designed to carry sev… [+11900 chars]

articles.author: Leah Stanfield
articles.title: Jeremy Clarkson forced to sell 'all adult cows' leaving calves 'crying' without mothers - Express
articles.description: Jeremy Clarkson has spoken out after the council ordered him to shut his farm restaurant, leaving him with no choice but to sell 'all his adult cows', leaving their calves abandoned.
articles.content:
Jeremy has since appealed, with his agents denying any breach of planning laws and claiming the council’s order is “excessive”.
However, as the planning row continues, the Grand Tour star admitted h… [+1575 chars]

articles.title: Chris Moyles ‘joins I’m A Celeb’ line-up alongside Loose Women and Love Island star - OK! magazine
articles.description: Former BBC Radio DJ Chris Moyles is said to be entering the Australian jungle alongside the likes of Boy George, Olivia Attwood and Charlene White.
articles.content:
Chris Moyles is the latest celebrity to be signed up for this years Im A Celebrity, according to reports.

articles.author: Samantha Ellis
articles.title: The Golden Mole and Other Living Treasure by Katherine Rundell review - The Guardian
articles.description: From bears to bats to hermit crabs, a witty, intoxicating paean to Earth’s wondrous creatures
articles.content: I was once taught a rhyme in case I met a bear: Bear brown, lie down; bear black, fight back. In The Golden Mole and Other Living Treasure, Katherine Rundell writes crisply that this advice requires … [+4232 chars]
